techmeme.title: A three-judge panel in US appeals court ruled, in a case involving AI generated poetry, that the Copyright Act requires human authorship for registration (Ashley Belanger/Ars Technica)
Google says it is "checking on a component quality issue" for the Pixel 9a, delaying its release from March to sometime in April; pre-orders are not yet open (Chris Welch/The Verge)
Q&A with Netflix's Ted Sarandos on his 25-year anniversary at Netflix, his cameo on Apple TV+ series The Studio, competing with suppliers like Disney, and more (Variety)
Apple says new EU interoperability rules "wrap us in red tape", force "us to give away our new features for free", and are "bad for our products" and users (Benjamin Mayo/9to5Mac)
The EU Commission orders Apple to open iOS to third-party connected devices, and in preliminary findings charges Google with breaking the DMA in search and apps (Barbara Moens/Financial Times)
